page.title: 18LIFE IN NOX.
page.content: The{small hamlet of Nox}is situated on the B4386 4 miles west of Shrewsbury. The local people shop at Yockleton, Lea Cross or Shrewsbury and rely on Yockleton for social activities such as Women's Institute, Mothers Union, Young Farmers and the church. The inhabitants find employment on nearby farms, at Butterfly World or further afield in Shrewsbury. A Blacksmith lives and works in{Nox.Services include: refuse collection once a week, milk deliveries and a postal service. Services consist of one delivery and two collections. A mobile butcher calls weekly and a Shropshire library van calls every other week. The hamlet is served by a limited bus service. The main issue of concern for the inhabitants is the speed of traffic along the B4386.
